info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 2:44AM PST until December 29 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet, with accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County above 3000 feet. This includes highway 3 south out of the Scott Valley and Sawyers Bar Road. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult because of blowing snow reducing visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
